Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip, multiple lines of cord-marked decoration around the shoulder and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394863) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394863)
